title: Ajanta and Post Ajanta Painting - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Painting - Module 3: Buddhist Art & Bagh Cave Paintings

questions.question: Which dynasty carried forward the tradition of sculpture and painting in northern India?
questions.explanation: The Gupta rule in northern India carried forward the tradition of sculpture and painting further.

questions.question: Who did Chandra Gupta-I marry?
options: Kumaradevi, a Princess of the Lichhavi tribe
questions.explanation: Chandra Gupta-I married Kumaradevi, a Princess of the Lichhavi tribe.

questions.question: When did Chandra Gupta-I ascend the throne?
questions.explanation: Chandra Gupta-I ascended the throne about 320 A.D.

questions.question: Who was Chandra Gupta-I's son and successor?
questions.explanation: The Gupta power was sustained by his son and successor Samudra Gupta (335-375).

questions.question: Who was known by the title Vikramaditya?
questions.explanation: Chandra Gupta-II (375-415) was known by the title of Vikramaditya.

questions.question: In which period were most of the Ajanta paintings done?
questions.explanation: Most of the Ajanta paintings were done in the Gupta and Vakataka period.

questions.question: What do Ajanta paintings completely cover?
options: The walls, pillars and ceiling of the caves
questions.explanation: The Ajanta paintings completely cover the walls, pillars and ceiling of the caves.

questions.question: What do Ajanta paintings illustrate?
options: Scenes from the life of Lord Buddha and his previous lives (Jatakas), floral and animal motifs
questions.explanation: They constitute a great gallery of Buddhist art illustrating scenes from the life of Lord Buddha and his previous lives comprise the Jatakas, floral and animal motifs, and stories.

questions.question: Where are the Bagh Caves located?
options: 50 km west of Mandu in Madhya Pradesh
questions.explanation: Bagh Caves of Madhya Pradesh are located 50 km west of Mandu, on a perpendicular rockface of a hill.

questions.question: Where are the Ajanta caves situated?
options: Over the winding bed of the Waghora River, sixty miles northeast of Aurangabad district in Maharashtra
questions.explanation: Ajanta caves are situated over the winding bed of the Waghora River, a small tributary of the Tapti river, sixty miles northeast of Aurangabad district in Maharashtra state.

questions.question: After what nearby village are the Ajanta caves named?
questions.explanation: The caves are named after the nearby village Ajintha.

questions.question: How high is the rocky hill of Ajanta caves?
questions.explanation: Ajanta Caves extends a rocky hill some 260 feet high and cut out of its sides along a stretch of 540 yards.

questions.question: How many caves are there at Ajanta?
options: Thirty caves, including an unfinished one
questions.explanation: There are thirty caves, including an unfinished one.

questions.question: Which caves at Ajanta are Chaitya halls?
questions.explanation: Caves 9, 10, 19, 26 and 29 are Chaitya halls (worshipping places).

questions.question: What is a Chaitya hall?
questions.explanation: Chaitya halls are worshipping places where Buddhist monks pray.

questions.question: What is a Vihara?
questions.explanation: Viharas are Monasteries where the monks lived.

questions.question: When were the Ajanta caves discovered?
questions.explanation: Ajanta caves were discovered in 1819 by some of the officers of the Madras regiment.

questions.question: Who was one of the officers who discovered Ajanta caves?
questions.explanation: One of them is Major John Smith who discovered the Ajanta caves.

questions.question: Who sent the first report on Ajanta caves to the Royal Asiatic Society?
questions.explanation: The first report on the Ajanta caves was sent to the Royal Asiatic Society by Lt. J.E. Alexandra in 1824.

questions.question: Which cave contains the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara painting?
questions.explanation: Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara painting is painted on the back wall of the hall in cave no 1.

questions.question: Who is Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara?
options: A Bodhisattva of compassion who refuses to go to Nibbana till everyone gets emancipated
questions.explanation: Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara is a Bodhisattva of compassion who refuses to go to Nibbana till everyone gets emancipated into the Dhamma.

questions.question: What is considered as Triratna in Buddhism?
questions.explanation: The Buddha, Dharma and Sangha is considered as Triratna.

questions.question: What is Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara wearing on his head?
questions.explanation: He is wearing a beautiful crown with beads on his head.

questions.question: What type of earrings is Bodhisattva wearing?
questions.explanation: In his ear, he is wearing a golden Kundala.

questions.question: What is a Kundala?
questions.explanation: Kundala is a big bangle type earring.

questions.question: Are Ajanta paintings full-fledged frescos?
options: No, the mode of painting is tempera or 'dry fresco'
questions.explanation: The paintings of Ajanta are not full fledged frescos. The mode of paintings at Ajanta is the tempera, 'dry fresco'.

questions.question: What is the difference between fresco and tempera?
options: Fresco is done while plaster is wet, tempera is dry fresco
Fresco uses oil, tempera uses water
questions.explanation: In fresco painting, painting is done while the surface layer of plaster is still wet. But the mode of paintings at Ajanta is the tempera, 'dry fresco'.

questions.question: What are the five colours usually found in Ajanta paintings according to Shilpa Sutra text?
options: Red Ochre (geru), Yellow Ochre (Pilimitti), black (Kajal), Lapis lazuli (Blue) and White (Lime or Khadia)
questions.explanation: The five colours usually described in the Shilpa Sutra text are: Red Ochre (geru), Yellow Ochre (Pilimitti), black (Kajal), Lapis lazuli (Blue) and White (Lime or Khadia).

questions.question: In which cave is the 'Apsara' painting found?
questions.explanation: The Apsara painting is from Cave No. 17.

questions.question: What is an Apsara?
options: A celestial dancing girl or nymph
questions.explanation: Apsara means celestial dancing girl or nymph.

questions.question: What are the six limbs of painting (Shadanga)?
options: Rupabheda, Pramana, Bhava, Lavanyayojanam, Sadrisyam, Varnikabhangam
questions.explanation: Shadanga or the six limbs of painting are composed of Rupabheda (Variety of form), Pramana (proper proportion), Bhava (depiction of emotion), Lavanyayojanam (Infusion of grace), Sadrisyam (likeness), and Varnikabhangam (mixing of colours).

questions.question: What is the skin color of the Flying Apsara?
questions.explanation: Her body colour is dark brown.

questions.question: What musical instrument is the Apsara holding?
questions.explanation: She is holding a musical instrument cymbal (Khartal) in her hand.

questions.question: What is Khartal?
questions.explanation: Khartal is a cymbal, which is a percussion instrument.

questions.question: In which cave is the 'Decoration on the Ceiling' found?
questions.explanation: This is a beautiful example of a ceiling decoration from cave no 2.

questions.question: What was the first coating on the cave wall before painting?
options: Clay mixed with rice husk, cattle dung and gum
questions.explanation: The first coating on the wall was of clay mixed with rice husk, cattle dunk and gum.

questions.question: In what color was the outline drawing made on Ajanta walls?
questions.explanation: The outline drawing was in dark brown or black and subsequently, colours and tones were added.

questions.question: What motifs are painted on the long panels and borders of cave ceilings?
options: Swans, birds, Vidyadhara couples, auspicious conches, lotuses and buds
questions.explanation: The long panels and borders from the ceiling of caves are painted with swans, birds, Vidyadhara couples, auspicious conches, lotuses and buds, as well as sinuous rhizomes and stalks.

questions.question: What does 'auspicious' mean?
questions.explanation: Auspicious means sacred or bringing good fortune.

questions.question: What are rhizomes?
options: Horizontal underground plant stems producing both roots and shoots
questions.explanation: Rhizomes are horizontal underground plant stems producing both roots and shoots.

questions.question: Which cave at Bagh has the dancing panel painting?
questions.explanation: The painting of a dance panel is in cave no. 4 at Bagh.

questions.question: How far is Bagh village from the Bagh caves?
questions.explanation: The Bagh caves are situated 7 km north away from Bagh village.

questions.question: How do Bagh paintings compare to Ajanta paintings in terms of maturity?
options: More mature with perfectly modelled human figures
questions.explanation: The Bagh paintings are more mature with perfectly modelled human figures.

questions.question: What does the dancing panel at Bagh depict?
questions.explanation: The painting depicts the performance of court dancers.

questions.question: How are the dancers at Bagh dressed?
options: Scantily dressed and decked with heavy jewellery
questions.explanation: The beautiful young dancers are scantily dressed out and decked with heavy jewellery.

questions.question: What instruments are mentioned in the Bagh dancing panel?
questions.explanation: The dancers are using their rhythmic footsteps to match the percussion beat of the drums and cymbals.

questions.question: What enhances the beauty of the Bagh dancers?
questions.explanation: The colourful costumes of the flower motifs enhance the beauty of these dancers.

questions.question: How many dancers are shown on the left side of the Bagh composition?
questions.explanation: There are seven dancers in the left side of the composition.

questions.question: What instrument is one lady playing that dangles from her neck?
questions.explanation: One of the ladies is playing a drum which is dangling from her neck covering her naked body.

questions.question: How many of the nine Bagh caves survive with classical paintings?
options: Only five of the nine caves
questions.explanation: Unfortunately, only five of the nine caves survive with these classical paintings.
